page.title: 19RECREATION IN SOUTH SHIELDS
page.content: Along the North Foreshore, a new road is to be built. The land near the beach is being developed commercially for leisure purposes. Nearby is the lifeboat memorial to designer William Wouldhave. This area is being tidied up and given new lighting schemes. The Amusement Park has many facilities to attract the day-visitor. Some of the illuminated signs, which surround the area, have been designed by local artist Robert Olley. Opposite the beach are the Marine Parks. The South Marine Park has fountains in the boating lake, a miniature railway and a paddling pool for children. Provision is being made for a caravan site in Bents Park. An elevated walkway is being built on the Foreshore to give views of the beaches and sea. An amphitheatre will stage exhibitions and plays.
